medical_history.chief_complaint: Cough, hoarseness, fever, and abnormalities on chest imaging.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient was well until 1 month before admission when a nonproductive cough developed. Over the next month, he experienced subjective fevers, particularly at night without sweats. One week before admission, hoarseness appeared, along with myalgias and dyspnea on exertion. Two nights before admission, his temperature rose to 38.9Â°C with night sweats. He reported no headache, sore throat, sputum production, chest pain, palpitations, bleeding, bruising, appetite changes, or neurological symptoms.
medical_history.past_medical_history: The patient had lost 4.5 kg in weight over the past 2 months. One month prior, a mass in the right testis was palpated, and ultrasonography showed a small right epididymal cyst and hydrocele. Previous surgeries included circumcision 5 years ago for phimosis. He is allergic to meperidine. No chronic illnesses or other significant prior medical history were mentioned.
medical_history.family_history: The patient's parents and two sisters are healthy. However, his maternal grandfather died of lung cancer at age 67, a paternal aunt died from fibrosarcoma at age 25, and a maternal aunt had sarcoidosis.
medical_history.social_history: The patient is a college student living with a roommate on a farm, exposing him to cows, horses, and wild dogs. He drinks alcohol occasionally, does not smoke, and has no history of illicit drug use. There was no recent travel history, although his roommate had traveled recently to Spain and had experienced a respiratory illness.
